image.altText: A tall building of units on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: Renters and experts are calling for change in one of just two Australian jurisdictions where renters can be evicted for no reason and the only place where landlords can raise rents more than once a year.

title.children: Renters urge reform of nation's 'worst' tenancy laws in 'landlord's market'

image.altText: Three people walk across a beach on the Timor Sea

props.synopsis: Hundreds of kilometres from the nearest supermarket, Indigenous rangers in Australia's remote north are working to keep eggs on your breakfast table.

title.children: How rangers in the remote north are keeping eggs on city shelves

image.altText: A woman with cropped hair, wearing glasses and a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Three decades after the landmark Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody, the Northern Territory parliament rejects a motion proposing the federal government establish an independent oversight body.

title.children: Motion calling for federal oversight of NT deaths in custody rejected

image.altText: A passenger yelling at a bus driver and pointing.

props.synopsis: Shocking video footage capturing the moment a bus driver was assaulted, and passengers were thrown through the air, has been played in the NT Supreme Court after the attacker pleaded guilty.

title.children: CCTV footage shows bus driver stomped on, passengers thrown to the ground

image.altText: A woman holds bills in front of her and looks stern

props.synopsis:
Kerrie Matthews has been forced to sell personal items to afford life-saving diabetes equipment, and with skyrocketing bills she is putting her house on the market and leaving the Northern Territory.


Â

title.children: $5 milk and $90 rent rises: NT cost of living pushing families into housing stress

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Santos's Darwin gas plant is set for a new lease of life despite a major methane leak. The company told federal officials the risk it could be forced to meet best practice on carbon emissions was "intolerable".Â

title.children: Prospect of net zero an 'intolerable risk' for leaking Santos plant

image.altText: An image from CCTV footage of a woman stabbing another woman.

props.synopsis: CCTV footage has emerged showing a random stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month. The Victorian opposition says its more evidence of Victoria's standing as the country's 'crime capital.'

title.children: Shocking vision of Melbourne CBD stabbing puts crime in spotlight

image.altText: Anonymised Data Forensics 2025-06-04 08:06:00

props.synopsis: Joshua's "passion project" with a radio scanner led to one of WA's most significant public health data breaches. His story highlights the challenges confronting autistic people caught up in the legal system.

title.children: How a 15yo autistic boy tinkering in his bedroom triggered a major data breach

image.altText: A dark-haired woman in a blazer.

props.synopsis: Liberal senator Jane Hume has backed calls from her colleagues to end the Coalition's period of introspection and start forming policies.

title.children: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74

image.altText: A Palestinian man with a beard sits unsmiling in a chair.

props.synopsis: Shadi Abu Sido spent 18 months in Israeli detention believing that his entire family had been killed in Gaza. Then he was reunited with his wife and children in Gaza.

title.children: 'That scene was indescribable': Shadi Abu Sido returns home to Gaza after months in prison

image.altText: A older man with grey hair and a moustache fixes his glasses.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's former national security adviser John Bolton has been charged with mishandling classified information.

props.synopsis: There is general agreement in Labor that Jim Chalmers is the government's best communicator. But insiders watching this race know Tony Burke is the master tactician.Â

title.children: Race between Chalmers and Burke pits communicator against tactician

image.altText: AI child abuse phone generic

image.altText: Workers in hazmat suits outside a post office.

props.synopsis: Authorities are working to identify the chemical that leaked from a single package at two post offices in Queensland. Four people of the people who were taken to hospital earlier have now been discharged.

title.children: Five people taken to hospital after chemical leak in Australia Post offices

props.synopsis:
"Papaya rules" have dominated Formula 1 for two seasons, but with both McLaren drivers in the heat of a world championship battle, Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris may no longer prioritise what is best for the team.

Â

title.children: Team orders are out of the window, Oscar can now play by 'Piastri rules'

image.altText: Close-up of an adult powerful owl showing its huge yellow eyes

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A deported star, a shock retirement and the hottest place on Earth

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market falls after a downbeat session on Wall Street, weighed down by a sell-off across US regional bank stocks. Gold jumped to a new record high, above $US4,300 an ounce, as investors flocked to safe haven assets amid US-China trade tensions. Follow live.

title.children: ASX slips as gold surges to new record above $US4,300

image.altText: Photo of Gus

title.children: New research claims lead was causing headaches even in ancient times

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

image.altText: Two men on a busy city street unroll an orange electrical cable.

title.children: From cult web series to cinema: Nirvanna the Band the Show the Movie

image.altText: A smiling female cricketer in an Australian uniform gestures with her bat.

title.children: Healy smashes World Cup's fastest ton as Australia books semifinal spot

image.altText: A black faced and winged bat with brown fluff at the bottom of the inside of a pine box with a meshy wall.

props.synopsis: Artificial roosts, or "bat boxes", have become a popular home conservation tool. But a new study raises concerns about the danger these boxes pose during heatwaves.
